column2: Cross the box that is closest to your son's current stage
column9: Please look at each of the drawings. It is also important to read the descriptions.
column17: 1 = The size and shape of the testes, scrotum (the sac holding the testes) and penis are about the same as when you were younger.
column18: 2 = The penis is a little bit bigger. The scrotum has dropped and the skin of the scrotum has changed. The testes are bigger.
column19: 3 = The penis has grown longer, the testes have grown and dropped lower.
column20: 4 = The penis is longer and wider. The head of the penis is bigger, the scrotum is a darker colour and bigger. The testes are bigger.
column21: 5 = The penis, scrotum and testes are the size and shape of a man's.

column2: Cross the box that is closest to the amount of pubic hair that you have.
column9: Please look at each of the drawings. It is also important to read the descriptions.
column17: 1 = There is no hair at all.
column18: 2 = There is a little soft, long, lightly coloured hair at the base of the penis. It may be straight or a little curly.
column19: 3 = The hair is darker and more curled. It has spread out and thinly covers a bigger area.
column20: 4 = The hair is as dark and curly as that of a man, but it hasn't spread out to the legs.
column21: 5 = The hair is like that of a man. It has spread out to the legs.
